data.title: Drew Gordon cause of death: Former 76er and Aaron Gordon's brother tragically passes away
data.meta_description: Tragic news hit the basketball community as former NBA player Drew Gordon was reported to have passed away on Thursday night. The Athletic's Shams Charania broke the news, rev
data.text:
Tragic news hit the basketball community as former NBA player Drew Gordon was reported to have passed away on Thursday night. The Athletic's Shams Charania broke the news, revealing that Gordon died in a car accident at the age of 33.

"Drew Gordon has passed away in a car accident at 33 years old. Gordon played nine games for the 76ers in the 2014-15 season and has played professionally in the US and abroad since college ball at New Mexico and UCLA. Drew is the older brother of Nuggets F Aaron Gordon. RIP," Charania tweeted.

Drew is Nuggets' star Aaron Gordon's brother

Gordon, who played college basketball at both UCLA and the University of New Mexico, had a brief stint in the NBA with the Philadelphia 76ers during the 2014-15 season. Following his time in the NBA, Gordon continued his professional career overseas, making a significant impact in various international leagues.

Fans and members of the media expressed their condolences and honored Gordon's memory on social media, reflecting on his contributions to the sport and the impact he had on those who knew him.

Drew Gordon is survived by his younger brother, Aaron Gordon, a forward for the Denver Nuggets, and his family. The basketball world mourns the loss of a talented player whose career, though cut short, was marked by determination and passion for the game.
